DataElement.preferredName: Other Mutation Abnormality Allele Burden Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric response regarding the measurement of the percentage ratio between mutant and wild type genes, other than those previously specified, in hematopoietic cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer._one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product._The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.:The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.

Concepts.definition: Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the ratio between mutant and wild type genes in hematopoietic cells.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
